1    | /**************************************************************************
2    | $Header: v_curs.c Fri 10-27-2000 8:08:55 pm HvA V2.01 $
3    | 
4    | DESC: Low-level cursor routines for HVA_WINDOWS
5    | HIST: 920223 V1.02
6    |       20001027 V2.01 - Adapting for DJGPP
7    | ***************************************************************************/
8    | 				  
9    | /*------------------------------------------------------------------------------
10   |                         HEADER FILES
11   | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------*/
12   | #include <bios.h>
13   | #include "v_video.h"
14   | 
15   | /*+ Local prototypes +*/
16   | static void v_get_cursor_shape(void);
17   | 
18   | /*+ Local varialbles +*/
19   | static int cursorstart = -1,
20   |            cursorend   = -1;
21   | 
22   | extern SCREEN _cursvar;
23   | 
24   | /*==============================================================================
25   |                         CURSOR FUNCTIONS
26   | ==============================================================================*/
27   | 
28   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
29   |     FUNCTION: v_get_cursor_shape()
30   |      PURPOSE: initialize cursor
31   |  DESCRIPTION: Get cursor shape by calling int 10h, function 03h
32   |               The shape will be stored int the local variables
33   |               'cursorstart' and 'cursorend'
34   |      RETURNS: nothing
35   |      HISTORY: 911230 V0.1
36   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
37   | static void v_get_cursor_shape()
38   | {
39   |   union REGS regs;
40   | 
41   |   if (cursorstart == -1 && cursorend == -1)
42   |   {
43   |     regs.h.ah = 3;              /* Get cursor position   */
44   |     regs.h.bh = 0;              /* Number of screen page */
45   |     int86(0x10,&regs,&regs);
46   |     cursorstart = regs.h.ch;
47   |     cursorend   = regs.h.cl;
48   |   }
49   | }
50   | 
51   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
52   |     FUNCTION: set_cursor_shape()
53   |      PURPOSE: Set the shape of the cursor
54   |  DESCRIPTION: Set the shape by setting the local variables 'cursorstart'
55   |               and 'cursorend' and calling cursoron()
56   |      RETURNS: nothing
57   |      HISTORY: 910710 V0.1 - Intial version
58   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
59   | void v_set_cursor_shape(int cstart, int cend)
60   | {
61   |   cursorstart = cstart;
62   |   cursorend   = cend;
63   |   v_cursoron();
64   | }
65   | 
66   | 
67   | 
68   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
69   |     FUNCTION: v_cursoroff()
70   |      PURPOSE: Turn cursor off
71   |  DESCRIPTION: Hide cursor by calling int 10h function 1.
72   |               The first and last screen line of the cursor will
73   |               be set to 20h. The values are out of the valid range
74   |               so the cursor will disappear.
75   |               First we will save the current cursor shape by calling
76   |               get_cursor_shape()
77   |      RETURNS: nothing
78   |      HISTORY: 911230 V0.1
79   | 
80   | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
81   | void v_cursoroff()
82   | {
83   |   union REGS regs;
84   | 
85   |   v_get_cursor_shape();
86   |   regs.h.ah = 1;
87   |   regs.x.cx = 0x2020;
88   |   int86(0x10,&regs,&regs);
89   | }
90   | 
91   | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
92   |     FUNCTION: v_cursoron()
93   |      PURPOSE: Turn cursor on
94   |  DESCRIPTION: Show the cursor by calling int 10h function 01h.
95   |               The first and last screenline of the cursor have
96   |               previously been saved by get_cursor_shape().
97   |      RETURNS: nothing
98   |      HISTORY: 911230 V0.1
99   | 
100  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
101  | void v_cursoron()
102  | {
103  |   union REGS regs;
104  | 
105  |   /*
106  |   get_cursor_shape();
107  |   */
108  |   regs.h.ah = 1;
109  |   regs.h.ch = (BYTE) cursorstart;
110  |   regs.h.cl = (BYTE) cursorend;
111  |   int86(0x10,&regs,&regs);
112  | }
113  | 
114  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
115  |     FUNCTION: v_setcurpos()
116  |      PURPOSE: Set cursor on (row,col).
117  |  DESCRIPTION: Uses BIOS interrupt 10h, function 02h.
118  |               The origin of the screen is (0,0).
119  |      RETURNS: nothing
120  |      HISTORY: 910710 V0.2 - Changed origin (1,1) to (0,0)
121  | 
122  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
123  | void v_setcurpos(int row, int col)
124  | {
125  |   union REGS regs;
126  | 
127  |   regs.h.ah = 2;
128  |   regs.h.bh = 0;
129  |   regs.h.dh = (BYTE) row;
130  |   regs.h.dl = (BYTE) col;
131  |   int86(0x10,&regs,&regs);
132  | }
133  | 
134  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
135  |     FUNCTION: v_getcurpos()
136  |      PURPOSE: Get the position of the cursor on the screen.
137  |  DESCRIPTION: Uses BIOS interrupt 10h, function 03h
138  |               The origin of the screen is (0,0)
139  |      RETURNS: nothing
140  |      HISTORY: 910710 V0.2 - Changed origin (1,1) in (0,0)
141  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
142  | void v_getcurpos(int *row, int *col)
143  | {
144  |   union REGS regs;
145  | 
146  |   regs.h.ah = 3;
147  |   regs.h.bh = 0;
148  |   int86(0x10,&regs,&regs);
149  |   *row    = regs.h.dh;
150  |   *col    = regs.h.dl;
151  | }
152  | 
153  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
154  | v_get_cursor_mode() -
155  | Gets the cursor type to begin in scan line startrow and end in
156  | scan line endrow.  Both values should be 0-31.
157  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
158  | int v_get_cursor_mode(void)
159  | {
160  |   short cmode=0;
161  | 
162  |   cmode = getdosmemword (0x460);
163  |   return (cmode);
164  | 
165  | }
166  | 
167  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
168  | v_gotoxy() - position hardware cursor at (x, y)
169  | Moves the physical cursor to the desired address on the
170  | screen. We don't optimize here -- on a PC, it takes more time
171  | to optimize than to do things directly.
172  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
173  | int v_gotoxy(int row, int col)
174  | {
175  |   union REGS regs;
176  | 
177  |   regs.h.ah = 0x02;
178  |   regs.h.bh = _cursvar.video_page;
179  |   regs.h.dh = (unsigned char) row;
180  |   regs.h.dl = (unsigned char) col;
181  |   int86(0x10, &regs, &regs);
182  |   return( OK );
183  | }
184  | 
185  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
186  | v_get_rows()    - Return number of screen rows.
187  | Returns the maximum number of rows supported by the display.
188  | e.g.  25, 28, 43, 50, 60, 66...
189  | 
190  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
191  | int v_get_rows(void)
192  | {
193  |     char *env_rows=NULL;
194  |     int rows=0;
195  | 
196  | /* use the value from LINES environment variable, if set. MH 10-Jun-92 */
197  | /* and use the minimum of LINES and *ROWS.                MH 18-Jun-92 */
198  |     rows = getdosmembyte(0x484) + 1;
199  |     env_rows = (char *)getenv("LINES");
200  |     if (env_rows != (char *)NULL)
201  |         rows = min(atoi(env_rows),rows);
202  | 
203  |     if ((rows == 1) && (_cursvar.adapter == _MDS_GENIUS))
204  |         rows = 66;
205  |     if ((rows == 1) && (_cursvar.adapter == _MDA))
206  |         rows = 25;  /* new test MH 10-Jun-92 */
207  |     if (rows == 1)
208  |     {
209  |         rows = _default_lines;  /* Allow pre-setting LINES   */
210  |         _cursvar.direct_video = FALSE;
211  |     }
212  |     switch (_cursvar.adapter)
213  |     {
214  |     case _EGACOLOR:
215  |     case _EGAMONO:
216  |         switch (rows)
217  |         {
218  |         case 25:
219  |         case 43:
220  |             break;
221  |         default:
222  |             rows = 25;
223  |         }
224  |         break;
225  | 
226  |     case _VGACOLOR:
227  |     case _VGAMONO:
228  | /* lets be reasonably flexible with VGAs - they could be Super VGAs */
229  | /* capable of displaying any number of lines. MH 10-Jun-92          */
230  | /*
231  |         switch (rows)
232  |         {
233  |         case 25:
234  |         case 28:
235  |         case 50:
236  |             break;
237  |         default:
238  |             rows = 25;
239  |         }
240  | */
241  |         break;
242  | 
243  |     default:
244  |         rows = 25;
245  |         break;
246  |     }
247  |     return (rows);
248  | }
249  | 
250  | /*+++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++
251  | v_get_columns()	- return width of screen/viewport.
252  | ++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++++*/
253  | int PDC_get_columns(void)
254  | {
255  |   int cols=0;
256  |   char *env_cols=NULL;
257  | 
258  |   /* use the value from COLS environment variable, if set. MH 10-Jun-92 */
259  |   /* and use the minimum of COLS and return from int10h    MH 18-Jun-92 */
260  |   regs.h.ah = 0x0f;
261  |   int86(0x10, &regs, &regs);
262  |   cols = (int)regs.h.ah;
263  |   env_cols = (char *)getenv("COLS");
264  |   if (env_cols != (char *)NULL)
265  |   {
266  |       cols = min(atoi(env_cols),cols);
267  |   }
268  |   return(cols);
269  | }
270  | 
271  |
